marklogic.body: Its very interesting to read Brian Moore`s article in today`s paper-that Lancaster`s start for England in the Cold of Leeds brought back memories of the beginning a new . That new Dawn was England with Geoff Cooke. Now many people wont remember that regime. But it was a regime built around honesty, with the likes of Moore, Probyn, Dooley, Haliday, Carling, Guscott, Richards, Underwood. The first appearance in a WC Final was the highlight. But those players really did play for the shirt. Lancaster has brought an ethic, an honesty here again. Lets hope he gets Wayne Smith on board & the RFU give Stuart Lancaster the time & backing his plans deserve.
